briefdescription.para: Action macro to pass into serctl or fdctl that activates the stream identifier.

detaileddescription.para: When used with serctl, the extra argument must be the little endian representation of the stream identifier (e.g. "sout" -> 0x74756f73)

briefdescription.para: Action macro to pass into serctl or fdctl that deactivates the stream identifier.

detaileddescription.para: When used with serctl, the extra argument must be the little endian representation of the stream identifier (e.g. "sout" -> 0x74756f73)

briefdescription.para: Action macro to pass into fdctl that enables blocking writes for the file.

detaileddescription.para: The extra argument is not used with this action, provide any value (e.g. NULL) instead

briefdescription.para: Action macro to pass into fdctl that makes writes non-blocking for the file.

detaileddescription.para: The extra argument is not used with this action, provide any value (e.g. NULL) instead

briefdescription.para: Action macro to pass into serctl that enables advanced stream multiplexing capabilities.

detaileddescription.para: The extra argument is not used with this action, provide any value (e.g. NULL) instead

briefdescription.para: Action macro to pass into serctl that disables advanced stream multiplexing capabilities.

detaileddescription.para: The extra argument is not used with this action, provide any value (e.g. NULL) instead

briefdescription.para: Action macro to check if there is data available from the Generic Serial Device.

detaileddescription.para: The extra argument is not used with this action, provide any value (e.g. NULL) instead

briefdescription.para: Action macro to check if there is space available in the Generic Serial Device's output buffer.

detaileddescription.para: The extra argument is not used with this action, provide any value (e.g. NULL) instead

briefdescription.para: Action macro to set the Generic Serial Device's baudrate.

detaileddescription.para: The extra argument is the baudrate.

briefdescription.para: Device Registration
RTOS FACILITIES
Device Registration
Unblocks a task in the Blocked state (e.g.

detaileddescription.para: waiting for a delay, on a semaphore, etc.).

memberdef.argsstring: (task_t target_task, task_t task_to_notify, uint32_t value, notify_action_e_t notify_action)
memberdef.name: task_notify_when_deleting

briefdescription.para: Notify a task when a target task is being deleted.

detaileddescription.para: This function will configure the PROS kernel to call task_notify_ext(task_to_notify, value, action, NULL) when target_task is deleted.

parameterdescription.para: The task being watched for deletion
The task to notify when target_task is deleted
The value to supply to task_notify_ext
The action to supply to task_notify_ext

briefdescription.para: Creates a recursive mutex which can be locked recursively by the owner.
Takes a recursive mutex.

parameterdescription.para: A mutex handle created by mutex_recursive_create
Amount of time to wait before timing out

simplesect.para: 1 if the mutex was obtained, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Gives a recursive mutex.

parameterdescription.para: A mutex handle created by mutex_recursive_create

simplesect.para: 1 if the mutex was obtained, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Returns a handle to the current owner of a mutex.

parameterdescription.para: A mutex handle

simplesect.para: A handle to the current task that owns the mutex, or NULL if the mutex isn't owned.

briefdescription.para: Creates a counting sempahore.

parameterdescription.para: The maximum count value that can be reached.
The initial count value assigned to the new semaphore.

simplesect.para: A newly created semaphore. If an error occurred, NULL will be returned and errno can be checked for hints as to why sem_create failed.

briefdescription.para: Deletes a semaphore (or binary semaphore)

parameterdescription.para: Semaphore to delete

briefdescription.para: Creates a binary semaphore.
Waits for the semaphore's value to be greater than 0.

detaileddescription.para: If the value is already greater than 0, this function immediately returns.

parameterdescription.para: Semaphore to wait on
Time to wait before the semaphore's becomes available. A timeout of 0 can be used to poll the sempahore. TIMEOUT_MAX can be used to block indefinitely.

simplesect.para: True if the semaphore was successfully take, false otherwise. If false is returned, then errno is set with a hint about why the sempahore couldn't be taken.

briefdescription.para: Increments a semaphore's value.

parameterdescription.para: Semaphore to post

simplesect.para: True if the value was incremented, false otherwise. If false is returned, then errno is set with a hint about why the semaphore couldn't be taken.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current value of the semaphore.

parameterdescription.para: A semaphore handle

simplesect.para: The current value of the semaphore (e.g. the number of resources available)

briefdescription.para: Creates a queue.

parameterdescription.para: The maximum number of items that the queue can contain.
The number of bytes each item in the queue will require.

simplesect.para: A handle to a newly created queue, or NULL if the queue cannot be created.

briefdescription.para: Posts an item to the front of a queue.

detaileddescription.para: The item is queued by copy, not by reference.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle
A pointer to the item that will be placed on the queue.
Time to wait for space to become available. A timeout of 0 can be used to attempt to post without blocking. TIMEOUT_MAX can be used to block indefinitely.

simplesect.para: True if the item was preprended, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Posts an item to the end of a queue.

detaileddescription.para: The item is queued by copy, not by reference.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle
A pointer to the item that will be placed on the queue.
Time to wait for space to become available. A timeout of 0 can be used to attempt to post without blocking. TIMEOUT_MAX can be used to block indefinitely.

simplesect.para: True if the item was preprended, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Receive an item from a queue without removing the item from the queue.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle
Pointer to a buffer to which the received item will be copied
Time to wait for space to become available. A timeout of 0 can be used to attempt to post without blocking. TIMEOUT_MAX can be used to block indefinitely.

simplesect.para: True if an item was copied into the buffer, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Receive an item from the queue.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle
Pointer to a buffer to which the received item will be copied
Time to wait for space to become available. A timeout of 0 can be used to attempt to post without blocking. TIMEOUT_MAX can be used to block indefinitely.

simplesect.para: True if an item was copied into the buffer, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Return the number of messages stored in a queue.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle.

simplesect.para: The number of messages available in the queue.

briefdescription.para: Return the number of spaces left in a queue.

parameterdescription.para: The queue handle.

simplesect.para: The number of spaces available in the queue.

briefdescription.para: Delete a queue.

parameterdescription.para: Queue handle to delete

briefdescription.para: Resets a queue to an empty state.

parameterdescription.para: Queue handle to reset

briefdescription.para: Filesystem

detaileddescription.para: Control settings of the serial driver.

parameterdescription.para: An action to perform on the serial driver. See the SERCTL_* macros for details on the different actions.
An argument to pass in based on the action

memberdef.argsstring: (int file, const uint32_t action, void *const extra_arg)
memberdef.name: fdctl

briefdescription.para: Control settings of the microSD card driver.

parameterdescription.para: An action to perform on the microSD card driver. See the USDCTL_* macros for details on the different actions.
An argument to pass in based on the action Control settings of the way the file's driver treats the file
A valid file descriptor number

An action to perform on the file's driver. See the CTL_ macros for details on the different actions. Note that the action passed in must match the correct driver (e.g. don't perform a SERCTL_* action on a microSD card file)
An argument to pass in based on the action

detaileddescription.para: Contains additional declarations for use by advaned users of PROS. These functions do not typically have as much error handling or require deeper knowledge of real time operating systems.
This file should not be modified by users, since it gets replaced whenever a kernel upgrade occurs.
